section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

overview.overview-text: Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Warning
Unattended children or animals in the vehicle can cause the vehicle to move and endanger themselves and traffic, for instance due to the following actions:

item.paragraph: Opening and closing the doors or windows.

warning.paragraph: There is a risk of accidents or injuries. Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle. Take the vehicle key with you when exiting and lock the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Children in the vehicle's heated interior

warning.paragraph: Warning

A hot vehicle may result in death to persons, especially children, or animals. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not leave persons, especially children, or animals unattended in the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Allow the child restraint system to cool down

warning.paragraph: Warning

Exposure to intense sunlight can cause child restraint systems and their components to become very hot. Persons may sustain burn injuries when touching the hot components. There is a risk of injury. Do not expose the child restraint system to direct sunlight or cover where necessary. If necessary, let the child restraint system cool down before transporting a child. Do not leave children unattended in the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Accident research shows that the safest place for children is in the rear seat.

Children younger than 12 years of age or shorter than 150 cm150 cm, 5 ft should be transported in the rear seat in child restraint systems designed for the age, weight and size of the child. Children 12 years of age or older must wear a seat belt as soon as a suitable child restraint system can no longer be used due to their age, weight, or size.

Children younger than 10 years of age or shorter than 4.6 ft/145 cm should be transported in the rear seat in suitable child restraint systems designed for the age, weight and size of the child. Children 10 years of age or older must wear a seat belt as soon as a suitable child restraint system can no longer be used due to their age, weight, or size.

Children younger than 13 years of age or shorter than 5 ft/150 cm should be transported in the rear seat in suitable child restraint systems designed for the age, weight and size of the child. Children 13 years of age or older must wear a seat belt as soon as a suitable child restraint system can no longer be used due to their age, weight, or size.

overview.overview-text: Use suitable child restraint systems

warning.paragraph: Warning

The seat belt cannot be fastened correctly on children shorter than 150 cm150 cm, 5 ft4.6 ft/145 cm5 ft/150 cm without suitable additional child restraint systems. The protective effect of safety gear, including seat belts, can be limited or lost when seat belts are fastened incorrectly. An incorrectly fastened seat belt can cause additional injuries, for instance in the event of an accident, braking or evasive maneuvers. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Secure children shorter than 150 cm150 cm, 5 ft145 cm/4.6 ft5 ft/150 cm using suitable child restraint systems.

section.title: Children on the front passenger seat
General information
section.paragraph: When using a rear-facing child restraint system on the front passenger seat, make sure that the front passenger airbag is deactivated.
If the front passenger airbag cannot be deactivated, do not transport children in suitable rear-facing child restraint systems on the front passenger seat.
Additional information:
Key switch for passenger airbag.
Before using a child restraint system on the front passenger seat, ensure that the front, knee, and side airbags on the passenger's side are deactivated.
Additional information:
For automatic deactivation of front passenger airbags.

overview.overview-text: Deactivating the front passenger airbags

warning.paragraph: DANGER

An active front passenger airbag can fatally injure a child in a rearward facing child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a danger to life. Make sure that the front passenger airbag is deactivated and that the PASSENGER AIRBAG OFF indicator light is illuminated.

overview.overview-text: Deactivating the front passenger airbags

warning.paragraph: Warning

Active front passenger airbags can injure a child in a child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the front passenger airbags are deactivated and that the PASSENGER AIRBAG OFF indicator light lights up.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Pay attention to the specifications and the operating and safety information of the child restraint system manufacturer when selecting, installing, and using child restraint systems.

If the child restraint system that is used supports the rear-facing installation method, this installation method must be used for safety reasons for children up to 18 kg18 kg, 40 lbs39 lb/18 kg and under 3 years of age. For actual uses, observe the specifications of the child restraint system manufacturer.

overview.overview-text: Child restraint systems after an accident

warning.paragraph: Warning

The protective effect of child restraint systems and their fastening systems which have been damaged or exposed to an accident can be limited or lost. A child cannot be properly restrained in the event of an accident, braking or evasive maneuvers. There is a risk of injury or danger to life.
Do not use child restraint systems which have been damaged or exposed to an accident.

If a child restraint system and its fastening system has been damaged or exposed to an accident, have these systems checked and replaced by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Ensuring the stability of the child restraint seat

warning.paragraph: Warning

The stability of the child restraint system is limited or compromised with incorrect seat setting or improper installation of the child seat. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Make sure that the child restraint system fits securely against the backrest. If possible, adjust the backrest tilt for all affected backrests and correctly adjust the seats. Make sure that seats and backrests are securely engaged or locked. If possible and necessary, adjust the height of the head restraints or remove them.

section.paragraph: Since your vehicle is equipped with a front airbag system for the front passenger seat that cannot be deactivated, the following warning is applicable:

graphic-with-description.paragraph: We do not recommend using rear-facing child restraint systems on the front passenger seat.

overview.overview-text: Extreme hazard

warning.paragraph: Extreme hazard
Do not use a rearward facing child restraint system on a seat protected by an airbag in front of it.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Note the instructions on the passenger's side sun visor.

overview.overview-text: Transporting children in the rear

warning.paragraph: Attention: note the information on the sun visor on the passenger's side. According to the traffic safety law, children must be transported in the rear. It is strictly prohibited to transport infants, toddlers, or children on the front passenger seat. Remark: this regulation applies to vehicles to be sold in Taiwan.

overview.overview-text: Deactivating the front passenger airbag

warning.paragraph: DANGER

An active front passenger airbag can fatally injure a child in a rearward facing child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a danger to life. Make sure that the front passenger airbag is deactivated and that the PASSENGER AIRBAG OFF indicator light is illuminated.

overview.overview-text: Deactivating the front passenger airbags

warning.paragraph: Warning

Active front passenger airbags can injure a child in a child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the front passenger airbags are deactivated and that the PASSENGER AIRBAG OFF indicator light lights up.

section.paragraph: Before mounting a rear-facing child restraint system on the front passenger seat, make sure that the front passenger airbag is deactivated. If the airbag cannot be deactivated, do not mount any rear-facing child restraint systems.
Additional information:
Key switch for passenger airbag.
Before installing a child restraint system in the front passenger seat, make sure that the front, knee and side airbags on the passenger's side are deactivated.
Additional information:
For automatic deactivation of front passenger airbags.

section.title: Warning sticker for installing a child restraint seat on the front passenger seat

overview.overview-text: Do not mount a child restraint seat facing the rear

warning.paragraph: DANGER

Active front passenger airbags can fatally injure a child in a rearward facing child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not mount a child restraint seat on the front passenger seat facing the rear.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A warning sticker is attached on the sun visor on the passenger's side. Check information.

overview.overview-text: Deactivating the front passenger airbag

warning.paragraph: DANGER

An active front passenger airbag can fatally injure a child in a rearward facing child restraint system when the airbags are deployed. There is a danger to life. Make sure that the front passenger airbag is deactivated and that the PASSENGER AIRBAG OFF indicator light is illuminated.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Note the instructions on the passenger's side sun visor.
Never use rear-facing child restraint devices on a seat with active front airbag. Use may result in death or serious injury to children.
Note the sign on the sun visor as needed.

item.paragraph: A. Especially children under age 13 may be injured due to the deployment of or crash on the airbag.
B. The rear seat can be safe for children.
C. Do not mount a child restraint seat on a front seat.
D. Placement must be as far away from an airbag as possible.
E. Please use the seat belt of the seat and child protection equipment.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Note the sign on the sun visor as needed.
The child restraint system must not be used on the seat with front airbag (in activated state)!

section.title: Seat position and height
section.paragraph: After installing a universal child restraint system, move the front passenger seat as far back as it will go, if possible, and bring it up to the top height. This seat position and height ensure the best possible position for the belt and offers optimal protection in the event of an accident.

After installing a child restraint system, move the front passenger seat as far back as it will go and, if possible, bring it up to the highest position. This seat position and height ensure the best possible position for the belt and offers optimal protection in the event of an accident.

After mounting a universal child restraint system, move the front passenger seat as far back as it will go and to the lowest position, if possible. This seat position and height ensure the best possible position for the belt and offers optimal protection in the event of an accident.

After mounting a child restraint system, move the front passenger seat as far back as it will go and, if possible, to the lowest position. This seat position and height ensure the best possible position for the belt and offers optimal protection in the event of an accident.
After mounting a universal child restraint system, adjust the tilt of the seat backrest so that the belt is not constrained.

If the upper attachment point of the seat belt is located in front of the belt guide of the child restraint seat, move the front passenger seat carefully forward until the best possible belt guide position is reached.

section.title: Backrest width
section.paragraph: Adjustable backrest width: Before installing a child restraint system on the front passenger seat, open the backrest width completely. Do not change the backrest width again and do not call up a memory position.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The seat belts in the rear and the front passenger seat belt can be permanently locked to fasten child restraint systems.
Depending on vehicle equipment, the rear seat belts and the front passenger seat belt can be locked to prevent them from being pulled out in order to attach child restraint systems.

action-step.paragraph: Pull out the belt strap completely.
Secure the child restraint system with the seat belt.
Allow the belt strap to be pulled in and pull it tight against the child restraint system. The seat belt is disabled.
Unbuckle the seat belt buckle.
Remove the child restraint system.
Allow the belt strap to be pulled in completely.

title.pcdata-case: LATCH or i-Size child restraint fixing system

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: LATCH: Lower Anchors and Tether for Children.

Pay attention to the specifications, operating tips and safety instructions from the child restraint system manufacturer when selecting, installing, and using ISOFIX or i-Size child restraint systems.
Pay attention to the specifications, operating tips and safety instructions from the child restraint system manufacturer when selecting, installing, and using LATCH child restraint fixing systems.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: i-Size is a legal regulation for child restraint systems that can be used to approve child restraint systems.
The system represents a further development of the LATCH child restraint fixing system.
LATCH child restraint fixing systems can also be attached to mountings with an i-Size identification.

entry.paragraph: When this icon is visible in the vehicle, the vehicle was additionally approved according to i-Size. The icon indicates the mounts for the lower mounts of the system. The lower mountings meet the European i-Size requirements.
The respective icon shows the attachment point for the upper retaining strap.

title.pcdata-case: Suitable ISOFIX or i-Size child restraint systems
Suitable LATCH child restraint fixing systems

section.paragraph: Only certain ISOFIX or i-Size child restraint systems may be used on seats suitable for them. The child restraint seat size class and category are indicated by means of letters or ISO labels on a tag on the child seat.

Only certain LATCH child restraint fixing systems may be used on seats suitable for them. The child restraint seat size class and category are indicated by means of letters or ISO labels on a tag on the child seat.

Information about the usability of child restraint systems on the respective seats when the child restraint systems are LATCH suitable or LATCH compliant: an overview of the suitable seats for child restraint systems is provided in the printed Owner's Manual.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When attaching child restraint systems with integrated belt to the mounts for lower anchors, pay attention to the following:
Do not exceed the total weight of child and child restraint system of 33 kg33 kg, 73 lbs.
The lower anchors may be used to attach the CRS to the vehicle seat up to a combined child and CRS weight of 65 lbs/30 kg when the child is restrained by the internal harnesses.

overview.overview-text: Properly engaging the lower LATCH anchors

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the lower mountings of the child restraint system are not correctly engaged, the protective effect of the child restraint system is limited. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Make sure that the lower mountings are correctly engaged and that the child restraint system fits securely against the backrest.

overview.overview-text: Use attachment points only for child restraint systems

warning.paragraph: Warning

The mounts for the lower mountings and attachment points of the child restraint system are intended for attaching child restraint systems only. If other objects are attached, the mounts or attachment points can be damaged. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Only attach child restraint systems at the corresponding mounts for the lower mountings or attachment points.

entry.paragraph: The corresponding icon shows the mounts for the lower ISOFIX or i-Size anchors.
The corresponding icon shows the mounts for the lower LATCH anchors.
Seats equipped with lower mountings are marked with a pair (2) of LATCH icons.
For vehicles equipped with a middle seat:
It is not recommended to use the inner lower mountings of standard outer LATCH positions to fasten a child restraint system on the middle seat. Use the vehicle seat belt instead for the middle seat.

section.paragraph: Depending on the equipment version, the vehicle is equipped with one of the covers shown for the lower mountings.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Mounts for the lower anchors are located behind the marked covers. To expose the mountings, open the flaps upwards.
Mounts for the lower mountings are located behind the marked covers.
To open: pull up on the loop.
To close: slide the cover down.

section.title: Before attaching child restraint systems
section.paragraph: Pull the seat belt away from the area of the child seat mountings.

action-step.paragraph: Mount child restraint system, see manufacturer's information.
Make sure that the child restraint system mount is correctly engaged in the lower anchor on both sides.

title.pcdata-case: Child restraint systems with upper strap
Child restraint systems with tether strap

overview.overview-text: Make sure the upper retaining strap is routed correctly

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the upper retaining strap is incorrectly used for the child restraint system, the protective effect is reduced. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the upper retaining strap does not run over sharp edges and is not twisted as it passes the upper anchor.

overview.overview-text: Lock rear seat backrests correctly

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the rear seat backrest is not locked, the protective effect of the child restraint system is limited or nonexistant. In certain situations, for instance braking maneuvers or in case of an accident, the rear seat backrest can fold forward. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Make sure that the rear seat backrests are locked.

overview.overview-text: Use attachment points only for child restraint systems

warning.paragraph: Warning

The mounts for the lower mountings and attachment points of the child restraint system are intended for attaching child restraint systems only. If other objects are attached, the mounts or attachment points can be damaged. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Only attach child restraint systems at the corresponding mounts for the lower mountings or attachment points.

section.title: Attachment points for upper retaining strap

entry.paragraph: The respective icon shows the attachment point for the upper retaining strap.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment, there are two or three attachment points for the upper strap of child restraint systems.

section.title: Attachment points for upper retaining strap

entry.paragraph: The icon shows the opening for the upper strap. Seats with an attachment point for the upper strap are marked with this icon. It can be found on the rear shelf.

The respective icon shows the attachment point for the upper retaining strap. Seats with an upper top tether are marked with this icon. It is located on the rear seat backrest, the rear shelf or the rear seat.

section.title: Attaching the upper retaining strap to the attachment point

action-step.paragraph: Guide the upper retaining strap over the head restraint to the anchor.
If there is a retaining strap, run it between the backrest and the cargo cover.
Attach the hook of the retaining strap to the mounting eye.
Tighten the retaining strap by pulling it down.
Outer seats: guide the upper retaining strap over the head restraint to the anchor.
For the middle seat, guide it over or along both sides of the head restraint to the attachment point where applicable.
If there is a retaining strap, run it between the backrest and the cargo cover.
Attach the hook of the retaining strap to the mounting eye.
Tighten the retaining strap by pulling it down.

section.title: Suitable seats for child restraint systems
General information
section.paragraph: Information regarding the usability of child restraint systems according to standards ECE-R 16 and ECE-R 129: a detailed overview is included in the printed Owner's Manual.

Information regarding the usability of child restraint systems on the respective seats if the child restraint systems are secured using a seat belt – according to standard GB 14166. You can find a detailed overview in the printed Owner's Manual.
The seats on the left and right of the rear seat bench are suitable for all child restraint seats recommended by the manufacturer.

section.title: Recommended child restraint seats
section.paragraph: Pay attention to the specifications, operating tips and safety instructions from the child restraint system manufacturer when selecting, installing, and using child restraint systems.
You can find a detailed overview in the printed Owner's Manual.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In accordance with ADR 34/03, provisions have been made to allow installation of a child restraint system at each rear seat position.
The attaching clip which is part of the upper retaining strap of a child restraint system – AS 1754 – can be attached directly to the corresponding mount.
Please refer strictly to the installation instructions supplied with the child restraint system.
Each seat position is fitted with a head restraint.

overview.overview-text: Use mountings for child restraint systems only

warning.paragraph: Warning

Mountings for child restraint systems are designed to withstand only those loads imposed by correctly fitted child restraint systems. Under no circumstances are they to be used for adult seat belts, harnesses or for attaching other items or equipment to the vehicle. After using and removing child restraint systems, fold down the anchor fittings again.

overview.overview-text: Lock rear seat backrests correctly

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the rear seat backrest is not locked, the protective effect of the child restraint system is limited or nonexistant. In certain situations, for instance braking maneuvers or in case of an accident, the rear seat backrest can fold forward. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Make sure that the rear seat backrests are locked.

overview.overview-text: Make sure the upper retaining strap is routed correctly

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the upper retaining strap is incorrectly used for the child restraint system, the protective effect is reduced. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the upper retaining strap does not run over sharp edges and is not twisted as it passes the upper anchor.

entry.paragraph: The respective icon shows the attachment point for the upper retaining strap.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment, there are two outer or three attachment points for child restraint systems with a tether strap.

section.title: Attaching the upper retaining strap to the attachment point

action-step.paragraph: Outer seats: guide the upper retaining strap on the side, on the vehicle outer side, around the head restraint to the anchor.

Middle seat: raise the head restraint, if needed, press the button on the mounts for this purpose. Guide the upper retaining strap between or along both sides of the supports of the head restraint to the attachment point.
If there is a retaining strap, run it between the backrest and the cargo cover.
Attach the hook of the retaining strap to the mounting eye.
Tighten the retaining strap by pulling it down.
Middle seat: lower and engage head restraints as needed.

section.title: Locking the doors and windows in the rear
General information
section.paragraph: In certain situations it may be advisable to secure the rear doors and windows, for instance when transporting children.

section.title: Doors

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Push the locking lever on the rear doors up.
Unlock or lock the safety switch on the rear doors with the integrated key.

section.paragraph: The door can now be opened from the outside only.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button. The LED is illuminated when the safety function is turned on.
The rear windows and doors are locked and cannot be operated in the rear.
The door can now be opened from the outside only.
Press the button on the driver's door.
Various functions are locked and cannot be operated in the rear such as the power windows.
